segments.text: I'm just watching the woman, still polishing that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her expression is so calm, so completely unbothered.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's in her own little world of domesticity.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she possibly not notice the water splashing around her feet?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's literally covering the floor where she stands.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Doesn't the sound of the overflowing water penetrate her thoughts?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And she's completely unaware of the children's antics right behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They're about to bring down a cookie avalanche and maybe themselves.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It makes me a little frustrated, her absolute obliviousness.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This peaceful scene is actually a ticking time bomb of small disasters.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She acts as if nothing unusual is happening at all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I suppose it's a testament to her concentration, but it's also quite alarming.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone really needs to shake her out of this trance.
segments.speaker: PAR
